answers.q: what is calcium oxide used for
answers.a: As a food additive (E529), it’s used mainly as an acidity regulator/alkalizing agent to raise pH and sometimes as a firming agent in certain foods.

answers.q: what is the formula for calcium oxide

answers.a: Yes—calcium oxide (CaO) is an inorganic compound, a basic oxide of calcium.

answers.q: what is the formula for calcium oxide?
why add calcium oxide in bayer process
answers.a: Lime (CaO) is added to Bayer liquors to react with silica and carbonate—forming insoluble calcium silicates and regenerating caustic (NaOH)—which improves clarification, reduces soda loss, and limits scaling.
